timeline.message:
Issue #5086 Review and rework o.e.j.util.Scanner

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Issue #5086 Improve ScannerTest

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Issue #5086 Fix javadoc

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText: Don't like this. File names are unique by definition, so there is no risk of duplicates. I would not add additional randomness caused by Set. If I really don't care, I'd use Collection -- the Set is supposed to be immutable anyway, right?
timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText: Not sure I understand your point. If it's a List then by definition I can have duplicates in a List, but I can't in a Set. Plus, you can't rely on ordering as it depends on the filesystem in what order scanned directories are visited, so List is a furphy.
replies.author: janbartel

timeline.bodyText:
Scanner.setRecursive() was deprecated, but there is no Javadoc about why.
This is the only usage of ScanningAppProvider._recursive which then should also be deprecated and removed?
timeline.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText: Add correspondent hashCode(). Use Objects.hash(...) if possible.
timeline.author: sbordet
sbordet
sbordet

timeline.bodyText:
Make it private because MetaData is package private.
Maybe make MetaData a private class too?
timeline.author: sbordet
sbordet
sbordet

timeline.bodyText: Make it private and replace with Jetty's Scheduler.
timeline.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText: Still worth to keep around Deprecated method?
timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText: I don't really want to mess with the WebAppProvider's filter for finding webapps to deploy at this late stage - it can be refactored at a later stage, so I've raised #5748 to track it.
replies.author: janbartel

timeline.message:
Issue #5086 Changes after review

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Issue #5086 Fix error on addFile

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Issue #5086 Add blocking method for immediate scan.

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Fixed scan(Callback) bug, returning early in case of failures.

More cleanups in code adding more privateness, getting rid of unnecessary exceptions, making fields final, etc.

Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet <simone.bordet@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: @sbordet this will return true even if the callback fails, which  is a bit strange.
timeline.author: gregw

replies.bodyText: @gregw I don't understand? If the 10 s elapsed, complete.await() would have returned false, and the return value would have been ignored. Now we return it so that a JMX call to this method would know if it timed out.
replies.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText: Scan is passed a callback. If it is failed then this method should return false.   Moreover I think if it times out then I think this method should throw a timeout exception rather than return
replies.author: gregw

replies.bodyText:
@sbordet ^
Also I don't like the 10second wait either, but not sure how to avoid other than infinite wait
replies.author: gregw

timeline.message:
Using capital case for static final field.

Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet <simone.bordet@gmail.com>
